result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory Allen Melin

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:47 AM Defendant Gregory Allen Melin appeared by video.  Attorney Brian Maloney appeared by video for Gregory Allen Melin.  Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling conference on November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Further proceedings on October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment on September 6, 2022 at 09:45 am.

MOTION TO MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BAIL- 
Attorney Maloney is requesting that the supervised contact with his own children be removed.  The defendant's wife will be going back to work, outside the home, and he needs to be the caregiver for the children.  They are also asking for supervised contact with the defendant's sibling's kids (nieces/nephews), which would include having prior authorization from the parents.
Attorney Scarpelli objects to these requests.
The Court comments and modifies the condition to allow the defendant to have unsupervised contact with his own children.  The request for contact with nieces and nephews and other minor children in the extended family will not be granted at this time.
Attorney Maloney to draft the order.
Arraignment is set for 09-06-22 at 9:45 a.m.  (by zoom)
Minutes.

Order Amending Conditions of Bai.
It is hereby ordered that the condition of bail prohibiting unsupervised contact by the defendant with his own children is amended to allow unsupervised contact with his own children.
It is further ordered that the request by the defendant to have supervised contact with his nieces and nephews is not granted at the present time, subject to additional information that may be presented to the court in the future.
Arraignment on September 6, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion to Amend Conditions of Bail.

records.addlTxt:
1:37 PM Defendant Gregory Allen Melin appeared by video.  Attorney Brian Maloney appeared by video for Gregory Allen Melin.  Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Stipulated to the identify from ZOOM conference.  Defense wishes to proceed to preliminary examination today.  Detective Sgt. Michael Stone sworn in and testifies.  Court clarifies testimony that was unclear.  Cross begins 1:43 p.m.  Witness is excused at 1:49 p.m.  No further questions or witnesses.
State argues for bind over.  Defense argues that probable cause has not been met and asked for dismissal.  Court finds that probable cause exists that a felony has been committed in Manitowoc County and that the Defendant committed it.  
Requesting an Arraignment at a later date for new charges.  Arraignment set.
Arraignment scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Arraignment on September 7, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

 - Jerome Melin @ 2921 Shade Tree Lane, Green Bay, WI 54313Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond.

Order for Prints.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 06-23-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts representations depicting nudity and 2 counts disorderly conduct.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on  06-27-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $20,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with anyone under the age of 18.  Supervised contact is permitted with  his own children.  Defendant must not have possession of a camera, camera enabled phone, or any device capable of taking a photographic image and maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.  Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
